intro: Thrixspermum patkaiensis, commonly known as the Patkai thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub structure with small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
